es6Introduction.title: What is ES6?
es6Introduction.description: ES6 (ECMAScript 6) is the 6th version of ECMAScript, introducing new features and syntax enhancements to JavaScript.

features.name: Arrow Functions
features.description: Shorter function syntax with lexical scoping of 'this'.

features.name: Variables
features.description: Defines variables with block scoping using 'let' and 'const'.

features.name: Array Methods
features.description: Provides concise ways to work with arrays using methods like .map().

features.name: Destructuring
features.description: Extracts values from arrays or objects and assigns them to variables.

features.name: Modules
features.description: Organizes code into separate files and imports/export functionality.
features.example:
export const name = 'Jesse';
export const age = 40;

defaultExports.title: React ES6 Default Exports
defaultExports.description: Allows exporting a single module/function from a file using default export.

importingModules.title: React ES6 Import
importingModules.description: Imports modules into a file using named exports or default exports.

jsxIntroduction.title: What is JSX?
jsxIntroduction.description: JSX (JavaScript XML) is a syntax extension for writing HTML-like code within JavaScript.

codingJSX.title: Coding JSX
codingJSX.description: Easier way to write HTML elements in React using JSX syntax.
